intro: Tomophyllum subminutum, commonly known as the dwarf starflower, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as willows and evening primroses. The plant features delicate, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, with five petals and prominent stamens. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Tomophyllum subminutum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
